results.title: Buying on credit
results.creator_credit: Coronet Instructional Films and Creative Establishment
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Consumer skills”.
Shows what credit is, how it works and some of the dangers involved in using credit. Uses a conversation between three young men to introduce finance charges, bank loans, downpayment, interest and instalment payments. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.description:

results.title: Buying services
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Consumer skills”.
Shows the need for savings and the importance of investing wisely. Uses the experiences of a young man involved in an automobile accident to illustrate the importance of being financially prepared through having shopped around for the best insurance cover. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Concepts in science: physics
results.creator_credit: David Chamberlain, Ontario Educational Communications Authority and Television Ontario
results.brief_description: This series is designed to be used as a teaching tool to explain concepts in physics. Each tape consists six episodes and each concept is accompanied by excellent computer graphics and explanatory diagrams.

results.title: Buying for immediate use
results.creator_credit: Frieda Dejarnette, Coronet Instructional Films and Spectrum Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Consumer skills”.
Rates the consumer shopping skills of three young shoppers making typical purchases for immediate use. Illustrates judging quality, price and service and determining which of these factors are valuable in making these purchases. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Frieda Dejarnette, Coronet Instructional Films and Spectrum Films

results.title: Bob Graham
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Lily Steiner and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cover to cover”.
Looks at the work of Bob Graham, an Australian author-illustrator. This successful illustrator has a clean, simple style which belies the depth and imagery of his work.

results.title: Clive eats alligators
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, David Ferris and Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cover to cover”.
Trevor Lunn interviews children’s writer Alison Lester about her children’s books particularly “Clive eats alligators”. She dicusses with children from South Melbourne Primary School her reasons and inspirations for writing and the choice of illustrations in her childrens’ books.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jeff Spencer, David Ferris and Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch
